title: Sr. Regional Reliability Manager
description:
Text to Apply! Text JOIN3154 to 845-400-TEAM (8326)

Company Overview

Balchem Corporation develops, manufactures and markets specialty ingredients that improve and enhance the health and well-being of life on the planet, providing state-of-the-art solutions and the finest quality products for a range of industries worldwide. Our corporate headquarters is located in Montvale, Nee Jersey and we have a broad network of sales offices, manufacturing sites, and R&D centers, primarily located in the US and Europe. Founded in 1967, Balchem is a publicly traded company (NASDAQ – “BCPC”) with annual revenues over $900 million and a market cap exceeding $4.0 billion. The company consists of three business segments: Human Nutrition & Health; Animal Nutrition & Health; and Specialty Products. Balchem employs over 1,400 people worldwide who are engaged in diverse activities, committed to developing the company into global market leadership positions. To learn more about our dynamic, stable and growing company, visit www.balchem.com

Position Summary

This role will report to the Director of Process & Reliability and be located at our Verona, MO plant. The Senior Regional Reliability Manager position provides strategic ownership of the Reliability and Maintenance programs, initially focused at the Verona site.

Essential Functions

 The Senior Regional Reliability Manager will maintain and improve performance of the company’s physical assets and monitor maintenance labor and material costs to achieve plant performance goals.  Drives improvement of maintenance and reliability performance/ work processes using KPIs.  Accountable for all site maintenance (routine and turnarounds) and reliability projects.  This position requires considerable interaction with plant leadership teams, engineering, corporate functional leadership, external support, and contractors.  Perform monthly bad actor “Equipment Failure Analysis” causing plant downtime to review / stablish the maintenance strategy and improvements proposals to eliminate the asset highest failure rate by organizing and facilitating site RCPS workshops within the site maintenance team.  Develops and implements the annual strategic objectives and budget for the maintenance organization to support the directives for the plant and monitors performance and cost effectiveness to meet goals.  Monitors maintenance and reliability spend across the region including labor, parts, and equipment; identifies trends and leads gap correction efforts.  Ensures the integrity and maintenance of all plant assets, including production equipment, facilities, utility equipment, and grounds.  Ensure capture and analysis of maintenance data and equipment work histories to support work of the site Maintenance Reliability engineers.  Selects, manages and works jointly with engineering or construction personnel in performing building structural, plant process, or other construction projects to make sure they conform to specifications and code requirements that necessary permits have been obtained, proper materials are on hand, and that projects proceed on schedule; may, from time to time, coordinates scheduling of and supervises work activities of contractors performing approved capital projects for the company; evaluates contractor work, sets expectations with contractor for safety performance, and ensures security of confidential information.  Leads implementation of spare parts inventory program best practices and ensures sustainment of stock management discipline.  Prepares activity reports, project proposals and cost analysis of replacing or repairing machinery, structures or other equipment as directed.  Review and optimize asset criticality, equipment maintenance strategies preventive, predictive and non-interventive strategies, and emergent work protocols.  Ensures proactive (preventive and predictive) work strategies (frequency, task lists and critical parts) are aligned with asset criticality analyses to ensure the most efficient and effective maintenance processes.  Assesses and recommend vendor and 3rd party maintenance services as necessary.  Conducts and facilitates Root Cause Failure Analysis for significant or repeat equipment failures, including FMEA as needed, and implements the maintenance strategy improvements to eliminate recurrence.  Ensures best practice utilization of CMMS systems including preventive and predictive maintenance procedures, ensuring the accuracy and completeness of the dataset and files.  Ensures best practice implementation and sustainment of workflow processes including but not limited to the effectiveness and efficiency of work request, work order creation, planning, kitting, scheduling, execution and work quality/closure.  Review and analyze data from inspections for information on equipment reliability issues on request of site maintenance engineers.  Analyzes CMMS data to improve equipment reliability and reduce maintenance costs and ensures visibility of performance to site managers.  Provides reliability and maintenance input on capital projects to guide project team on reliability and maintainability of the equipment. Provides input on the technical check out, equipment check out and commissioning of new assets. Ensures project related changes in equipment strategies and equipment specifications are updated in the CMMS database.  Provides technical expertise for PSM and mechanical integrity programs.  Provides benchmark/industry data for reliability improvement. 


Requirements

 5+ years in Maintenance/ Reliability/ Engineering in a PSM regulated Chemical Plan.  Ability to build strategic relationships with key stakeholders across the operation to ensure improved collaboration and deliver results.  Experience with PSM systems and hazardous processes (OSHA 1910.119), CMMS, RCA, PM and Maintenance Work Process.  Experience using CMMS and ERP software. 


#IN

Balchem is committed to a workplace culture that values and promotes diversity, inclusion, equal employment opportunities, and a work environment free of harassment and hostility.

title: Florida Blue, Consultant Ia - Business Support
description:
Must be available to travel. Expected travel includes 3 weeks out of the whole year to either of the following locations: North Carolina, California, Texas, and Florida.* 


Job Summary

Consultants are seasoned, subject matter experts who apply specialized knowledge, typically as an individual contributor, in matters that require special interpretation or expertise. Incumbents use their discipline-specific and/or institutional knowledge to perform department activities. They participate in and/or lead critical, high-risk, complex initiatives, programs and projects, have frequent contact with internal and external business partners, facilitate/ influence strategic thinking and direction and influence peers and leaders across the organization to act on issues that have organization-wide impact. Incumbents may directly manage a small number of employees (two or less); the primary function of the role is consulting.

The Consultant Ia will support the development and implementation of new IT capabilities and surrounding business processes as the Business Lead for these new solutions. This role’s primary function will be to provide detailed direction and SME support on behalf of the Customer Management Senior Leadership to ensure IT capability and business projects meet the defined scope, remain on track to meet deliverables and improve the overall customer experience of our members. In addition to participating as the business representative in IT development sessions, this role will assess, design and implement corresponding business processes that complement the IT capabilities that are being developed. This role is also responsible for managing ad hoc project and operational issues that are identified through the development and ongoing operations after implementation.

Essential Functions

 Support the identification, alignment and implementation of strategy and process enhancements within existing processes, technology and resources and, ensure development projects remain on task and schedule to meet deliverable from both an IT and business perspective.  Identify and assess risk, evaluate controls, and Enterprise operational impacts to processes. Prepares findings and recommendations.  Responsible for synthesizing and communicating business needs/requirements to IT development teams in addition to providing prioritization and direction to IT partners as decision points are reached during the development process.  Serve as subject matter expert and primary representative for business needs in scrum sessions with IT business partners, providing direction on concepts and feedback to development teams.  Design and implement necessary business processes (e.g. workflow, control monitoring, exception processes, SOPs, DTPs etc.) corresponding to newly implemented vendor and IT capabilities.  Act as the linkage between IT and business process development to ensure designs meet business needs to include adequate controls, reporting capabilities and necessary business process functionality.  Support business development of new capabilities and functions by championing the capabilities through various key business partners/functions. Develop and maintain successful working relationships with business partners, development teams, vendor partners and Service Organization leadership.  Leads or participates in annual business process mapping process with IT partners.  Leads collaboration efforts to work through complexities associated with coordination across multiple areas, conflicting efforts and limited resources.  Participates in monitoring and evaluating the effectiveness of technology solutions, policies, practices, and processes and establishing metrics for released applications. 


Qualifications

Required Work Experience

 6+ years related work experience. 


Required Education

 Related Bachelor’s degree or additional related equivalent work experience 


 Additional Requirements: 

 Two or more years of business lead experience in executing complex initiatives  Experience with business requirements and business process analysis to ensure IT solutions meet the needs with knowledge of system development concepts & methods  Experience with multiple IT development processes and methodologies  Strong knowledge and experience of the development of communications Experience managing multiple priorities and ability to facilitate adoption of changing priorities to consistently achieve business results and shape our culture  Demonstrated ability to proactively identify, address and resolve complex issues through collaboration, negotiation and relationships Excellent communication skills including ability to explain complex technical concepts in a clear and concise manner to audiences with diverse knowledge base 


Preferred Requirements

 Experience and proficiency in the Enrollment & Billing environment and systems, including: EnrollPoint, SellPoint, Members Edge, RBMS and Siebel  Experience in delivering initiatives aligned to the Maintain Eligibility journey  Experience and proficiency in Ancillary platforms and products Demonstrated experience coordinating, providing direction to and ensuring contractual Service Level Agreements are met with vendors 


General Physical Demands

Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally to move objects. Jobs are sedentary if traversing activities are required only occasionally.

What We Offer:

As a Florida Blue employee, you will thrive in our Be Well, Work Well, GuideWell culture where being well as an individual, and working well as a team, are both important in serving our members and communities.

To support your wellbeing, comprehensive benefits are offered. As an employee, you will have access to:

 Medical, dental, vision, life and global travel health insurance;  Income protection benefits: life insurance, Short- and long-term disability programs;  Leave programs to support personal circumstances;  Retirement Savings Plan includes employer contribution and employer match;  Paid time off, volunteer time off, and 11 holidays  Additional voluntary benefits available; and  A comprehensive wellness program 


Employee benefits are designed to align with federal and state employment laws. Benefits may vary based on the state in which work is performed. Benefits for intern, part-time and seasonal employees may differ.

To support your financial wellbeing, we offer competitive pay as well as opportunities for incentive or commission compensation. We also conduct regular annual reviews with pay for performance considerations for base pay increases.

Annualized Salary Range: $88,100 - $143,100

Typical Annualized Hiring Range: $88,100 - $110,100

Final pay will be determined with consideration of market competitiveness, internal equity, and the job-related knowledge, skills, training, and experience you bring.

We are an Equal Opportunity/Protected Veteran/Disabled Employer committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable culture for our employees and communities.

title: Index Platform - Prod. Manager – Index Data Enrichment
description:
FTSE Russell is establishing a new platform strategy organisation focused on developing target state Index capabilities to transform the core Index Platforms and scale growth for FTSE Russell

The Senior Product Manager – Index Data Enrichment will report to the Index Platform Strategy - Data Director and will be a stakeholder in the development of the future state FTSE Russell Index Platform. This role will require the candidate to successfully interact with wide stakeholder group, designing solutions, owning specifications used for development, and ensuring sound execution. They will serve as a bridge between FTSE Russell customers, business stakeholders, other technology capabilities within FTSE Russell and outside FTSE Russell, and the Delivery organisation, they will input into the Data roadmap in line with broader Index Platform Strategy and Vision. Critical to the role is a strong Agile and collaborative mindset, working well across many diverse groups and balancing outcomes that help drive capability excellence but also FTSE Russell goals.

Responsibilities

Contributes to the roadmap for their capability area, communicating that across FTSE Russell to the wider stakeholder groups.Defines requirements for new platform, ensuring these are well articulated and understood by technologyDelivers against set objectives for a medium product or cluster of medium products with a considerable level of expertise and specialisation in the relevant product lines.Understands overall product roadmap and strategy, tracking strategic KPIs, drawing insights and conclusions from data to input into roadmap decisions.Manages own work proactively and other’s accordingly and as directed by senior colleagues to meet overall objectives, providing coaching and development for more junior colleagues.Contributes to product marketing to ensure content is appropriately providedSeeks the expansion / improvement of existing products within own remit rather than the conceptualisation of new products, establishing the business case for product enhancements.Ensures client engagement, communicates roadmaps to the client community and is responsible for feedbackProvides guidance on strategy, design, business requirements, feature and functionality trade-offs and release schedule for a proposition, set of propositions, products, or services.Leads cross-functional teams in order to ensure dependencies for proposition, product or service delivery are met, following relevant lean, agile and ways of working methodologies.Works closely with client teams to gather and prioritize client feedback to drive innovation and increase client adoption and retention.

Key Behaviours

Articulate, creative, energetic person able to work alongside the teamExceptional written and oral communication skillsAbility to communicate with diverse audiences, ranging from highly technical partners to business clientsExcellent attention to detail with the ability to think logically to solve business problems.Ability to establish credibility and build strong, confident, collaborative relationships with business and technology stakeholders including external parties, at all levelsAbility to work under pressure and to tight deadlines without compromising qualityResults driven, self-motivated, problem solving, and solutions oriented; takes pride in his/her workDemonstrates a can-do attitude, exhibits self-confidence, leadership, and adaptability to business changeExcellent organisational, negotiation, presentation, and time management skills; ability to manage business expectationsAbility to keep abreast of and understand technology trends, see how they impact your roadmap, and how they drive innovation

Profile/Skills

Extensive knowledge of market data, security reference data, primarily equities, bonds, mortgages, etc., security pricing, FX and interest rates, corporate actions, company/issuer reference data and industry classification and company fundamentals.7+ years of relevant work experience in product ownership / technology / business analysis / operations / application delivery in banking or financial domain.Exposure to how data is used within indexes and/or how indexes and index data are used by financial institutions (Fund, Portfolio or Wealth Management)Experience in Data Analysis, Logical Data Modelling, Data Transformation including Business Transformation and Validation, and Data ManagementExperience in dealing with end clients.Experience with Agile delivery

LSEG is a leading global financial markets infrastructure and data provider. Our purpose is driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth.

Our purpose is the foundation on which our culture is built. Our values of Integrity, Partnership, Excellence and Change underpin our purpose and set the standard for everything we do, every day. They go to the heart of who we are and guide our decision making and everyday actions.

Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 65 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. You will be part of a collaborative and creative culture where we encourage new ideas and are committed to sustainability across our global business. You will experience the critical role we have in helping to re-engineer the financial ecosystem to support and drive sustainable economic growth. Together, we are aiming to achieve this growth by accelerating the just transition to net zero, enabling growth of the green economy and creating inclusive economic opportunity.

LSEG offers a range of tailored benefits and support, including healthcare, retirement planning, paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives.

We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. This means that we do not discriminate on the basis of anyone’s race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. Conforming with applicable law, we can reasonably accommodate applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs.

title: Project Engineer - Plastics
description:
The Project Engineer is responsible for managing projects as part of the Asset Management Team. These projects are primarily the design, installation and modification of capital equipment and facilities, including the oversight and direction of internal and external resources. This position will have responsibility in all of ConMet’s global manufacturing sites, with manufacturing processes that include Plastic Molding, Machining, Assembly and Material Handling.

This role requires working at ConMet's corporate headquarters in Vancouver, Washington or out of the Canton, NC plastics manufacturing facility. 

Key Duties 

 Manage the definition, quoting, procurement and commissioning of manufacturing equipment.Provide support to the product design effort: Plastic components and assemblies.  Provide input to DFM/DFA processes to ensure best-practice and lean manufacturing concepts are utilized in the design and implementation of manufacturing equipment.Maintain project timelines and deliverables to support internal and external customers.  Strong collaboration with local plant management and technical staff is necessary.  Ability and willingness to travel up to 30% of the time and work extended hours based on customer demand and production schedule.  Support all APQP phase deliverables in support of manufacturing equipment development for new or modified manufacturing processes.Support all downstream aspects of manufacturing processes from our production facilities though our end customer final assembly.  

Required Qualifications 

 Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical, Industrial or Manufacturing Engineering.Minimum 3 years of experience in a production environment.Strong Project Management skills – PMI or PMBOK certification is a plus.Experience in lean manufacturing, setup reduction, capital procurement, automation, statistical process control, project management, process development, and material flowWorking knowledge of AutoCAD/and ProE, or similar CAD systems.Working knowledge of GD&T and the use of attribute gage systems.Ability to manage multiple priorities and projects simultaneously.Effective communication skills with all team members both internal and external.Strong computer skills in MS Office.Metrology capabilities with basic instruments, such as micrometer, comparator, et al.  

Preferred:

 Manufacturing process knowledge including plastic molding, machining, robotic and manual material handling, and various assembly methods along with general understanding of process flow, gages, in-process verification and error proofing.Knowledge of SAP or similar ERP systems. Ability and experience in establishing and maintaining working relationships with equipment vendors, integrators and suppliers. Ability to speak Spanish is a significant plus.  

About ConMet 

ConMet, a division of Amsted Industries, is a leading global supplier of wheel hubs, aluminum castings, and structural plastics to original equipment manufacturers and aftermarket channels in the commercial vehicle industry. Founded in 1964, ConMet innovation has been critical in designing, engineering, and manufacturing revolutionary technologies for trucks and trailers. Today, ConMet products are standard equipment on most heavy-duty vehicles in North America and have a growing footprint worldwide.

ConMet is committed to creating products and services that align with critical customer needs. The development of more efficient products, processes, and technology that transform the way customers run and maintain their vehicles is central to ConMet’s vision.

Diversity & Inclusion Pledge

At ConMet, differences are not ignored, but celebrated. Our goal is to encourage a deeper knowing of our people, pulling out knowledge and experiences to ignite creativity. We are committed to achieving workplace equity by intentionally creating a work environment where all people are respected, accepted and have a sense of belonging.

Because people are what drive our success, ConMet’s Diversity and Inclusion program empowers all employees to embrace their individuality and share their abilities to further our innovations, thus improving the lives of our employees and customers, and strengthening our position as a leader in our market.

Compensation & Benefits 

 New hires generally start between $74,567 - $106,525. The full salary range for the position, across all geographies is, $74,567 - $127,830 per year. The upper portion of the salary range is typically reserved for existing employees who demonstrate strong performance over time. Starting salary will vary by location, qualifications, and prior experience.Targeted annual bonus is based on company performance to objectives during the fiscal plan year which runs from October 1 – September 30.Comprehensive employee benefits package, including medical/dental/vision coverage, life and disability protection.Vacation plan – ConMet offers exempt employees a paid vacation benefit that provides the flexibility to take time off from work based on factors including good discretion, sound performance, and consideration of overall team and business needs.Paid sick leave up to 10 days (80 hours) per calendar year.ConMet offers an extremely strong retirement package: ESOP - Participation (100% company paid) in the ConMet/Amsted Employee Stock Ownership Program (ESOP). The Company contributes 10% of considered compensation into this plan each fiscal year.401k - The Company provides a 401(k) Plan with a 4% employer contribution match.  Ten paid holidays per year.Wellness reimbursement.  

ConMet provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression or any other characteristics protected by federal, state, or local laws (“Protected Characteristics”). Ensuring fair wages is an important Company value. Accordingly, the Company will not pay wages to any employee at a rate less than the Company pays to other employees for work that is substantially equivalent and requires comparable skills unless a bona fide factor justifies a pay differential. The Company prohibits pay disparity based on Protected Characteristics or prior salary history. The Company prohibits retaliation against employees for discussing compensation.

title: Controller (Multi site)
description:
Controller

(Multi site)

Overview

Our client, a Fortune 100 firm employing well over 200,000 people in over 200 sites worldwide is seeking a Multi-Site Controller. The ideal candidate will manage/oversee the adherence to financial policies and ICRF controls, improving internal business processes to support the growth/profitability.

You will play a key role as part of the site leadership team. This is a highly visible position, whereas you’ll become the Plant Managers “right-hand". You will provide financial analyses and recommendations to ensure the sites alignment with overall strategic objectives.

Leads the month-end close processes & ensures alignment with HPS/LS deadlines. Leads the annual standard cost development process for the sites to ensure transparency of cost/margin.

Responsibilities

Lead the annual RF1/3 forecast, budget, plan process at the sites and providing accurate explanations of significant variances, including analysis of actual vs. budget and/or forecast. Focus on timely month-end results/reporting, with review of strategic objectives, to ensure the business growth & profitability.

Process oversight/management of month-end close (QAD, DSS inputs & reconciliations to Blackline) to ensure alignment of the HPS/LS deadlines, prepare, approve general entries/reconciliations (as needed/required), and ensure accuracy/integrity of the balance sheet (quality of working capital, changes in fixed assets, etc.).

Lead the annual completion of the ICRF gap analysis & ensure the execution of action plans, adherence - Segregation of Duties, system/access controls are in place. Evaluate site internal controls (review of HPS/LS policies, purchasing authorities, etc. to ensure alignment with internal controls along with the 6 essentials). Assessing current accounting processes, offering recommendations for improvement, and implementing new innovative processes.

Support LS & Operations Controller with the AD HOC requests, annual plan, budget & standard cost development process. Proactively interact with supervisors, plant leadership team as well as senior management to ensure all parties have a clear and accurate picture of the plant’s overall financial performance. Proactively researching issues – anticipating opportunities and providing answers & insight to key questions before they are asked.

Support WCM initiatives (participation in Kaizen’s, problem-solving events) ensuring countermeasures, projects are defined with clear financial objectives & results are tracked and reported accordingly. Co-manage along with the project manager the capital process & provide guidance/assistance preparing Madison’s, CARs…Creation of forward-looking financial models and “what-if” modeling capabilities, cost/benefit, margin impact (make vs. buy, etc.) enhancing the decision-making process.

Coordinate physical inventory and cycle count program to achieve sites goals. Ensure the annual physical & fixed asset counts are properly conducted and adhere to the set policies/procedures for the site.

Education

Bachelor's Degree - Accounting or Finance; Required. Master's Degree - Accounting or Finance; Preferred. Certified Public Accountant; Preferred. 

Experience:

3+ years’ experience within cost accounting/finance within manufacturing environment.

3+ years’ experience working with/supporting Corporate/Finance (ie. performing/providing financial &/or operational analysis).

Knowledge/Experience with Cost-Accounting, CAPEX, Production, Purchasing, Labor & Transport Costs, Inventory, Project Budgets, Manufacturing Forecasting, Planning & Analysis, S&OP, Quantitative Analysis.

Ability to understand all changes in manufacturing, commercial strategy and provide insight & commentary related to the financial impact.

ERP Systems Experience (i.e. SAP, QAD, Oracle, etc.).

Upwards of 20% travel for business, training, etc.

The client offers a competitive salary package that is dependent on qualifications and experience, as well as a strong benefit package, plus participation in a company-wide bonus plan. For immediate consideration and faster response, please forward current resume to: sb@scientificsearch.com. Please include job #18640 in subject line. title: Commercial Plumbing & HVAC Project Manager
description:
Performance Plumbing & Heating is seeking a dynamic and dedicated Permanent Project Manager to join our team. In this role, you will be the driving force behind the successful planning, execution, monitoring, control, and closure of plumbing projects. You will be responsible for the overall coordination of design, procurement, scheduling, and construction processes. With your expertise in plumbing and mechanical construction, you will ensure the delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone looking to take their career to the next level in a fast-paced, challenging, and rewarding environment.

Responsibilities

Oversee and manage all aspects of plumbing projects and HVAC from inception to completion.Coordinate with clients, subcontractors, suppliers, and internal teams to ensure smooth project execution.Create, implement, and monitor project schedules and budgets, making adjustments as needed to meet targets.Ensure compliance with all safety and regulatory standards, including building codes, OSHA requirements, and local regulations.Conduct site visits to monitor progress, address issues, and ensure quality standards are met.Work with and direct project foreman to run the work force at the highest of their ability.Create and submit RFIs, submittals, and change orders to general contractor for approval.Prepare and present project updates and progress reports to clients, management, and team members.Resolve any project-related issues promptly and professionally, escalating to senior management when necessary.Foster a positive and collaborative work environment, promoting teamwork and communication.

Qualifications

Minimum of 3 years of experience in project management, specifically within the plumbing and mechanical construction field.Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Engineering, or a related field is preferred.Proven track record in managing and delivering plumbing projects on time and within budget.Strong understanding of plumbing systems, mechanical construction processes, and industry best practices.Exceptional project management skills, including planning, scheduling, budgeting, and coordinating resources.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to lead and work collaboratively with diverse teams.Proficiency in project management software and tools.Ability to read and interpret blueprints and technical drawings.Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.Must possess a valid driver's license and be willing to travel as needed.
